    • getVersion

      public ServerVersion getVersion()
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Get the version of the server, including application version and schema version. The application version is in the format: [major].[minor].[build]. The scheme version is in the format: [base].[vertical].
      Specified by:
      getVersion in interface ISystemTools
      Returns:
      Version of the server, including application version and schema version.

    • submitDBCCBatchJob

      public ProcessID submitDBCCBatchJob(String[] tablesToCheck, String[] consistencyCheckTypesToCheck) throws ServerStateException
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Run a subset of the consistency checks on the underlying physical database. Please use getDBCCState() to check on the state of the run.
      Specified by:
      submitDBCCBatchJob in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      tablesToCheck - null - check all tables, else array of tables names to check
      consistencyCheckTypesToCheck - null - check all types, else array of types to check Must be valid ConsistencyCheckTypes.
      Returns:
      Process ID of submitted batch job
      Throws:
      ServerStateException

    • getDBCCState

      public WorkItemSetState getDBCCState() throws ServerStateException
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Returns the state of the consistency checks process. Only one set of consistency checks can be running at any given moment.
      Specified by:
      getDBCCState in interface ISystemTools
      Returns:
      the state of the consistency checks process
      Throws:

    • submitUpdateStats

      public void submitUpdateStats(String description, boolean incremental) throws ServerStateException
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Run the update stats process on the underlying physical database. Please use getUpdateStatsState() to check on the state of the run.
      Specified by:
      submitUpdateStats in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      description - null - Description of the job
      incremental - true: the process should perform an incremental update; false: the process should perform a full upgrade
      Throws:
      ServerStateException

      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools

      Specified by:

    • submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob

      public ProcessID submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob(boolean includeDatabaseStatistics, long beginIntervalID, long endIntervalID) throws ServerStateException
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Run the batch job to create a SQL Server Performance Snapshot report. This version of the report will include an analysis of the Query Store statistics. The begin and end intervals are required.
      Specified by:
      submitSqlServerPerfReportBatchJob in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      includeDatabaseStatistics - Whether to snapshot the state of the database statistics
      beginIntervalID - first interval in the Query Store, exclusive, on which to run the report
      endIntervalID - last interval in the Query Store, inclusive, on which to run the report
      Returns:
      Process ID of submitted batch job
      Throws:
      ServerStateException

    • setRunlevel

      public void setRunlevel(SystemRunlevel runLevel) throws ServerStateException
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Sets the run level of the server. If the server is currently undergoing a runlevel change, this method will block until that level change has completed.

      The valid run levels that the server can be set to through this method are SystemRunlevel.GW_DB_MAINTENANCE, SystemRunlevel.GW_MAINTENANCE, and SystemRunlevel.GW_MULTIUSER. See the definitions of those constants for more information.

      Specified by:
      setRunlevel in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      runLevel - The level at which the server should run.
      Throws:
      ServerStateException - if the server is already at that level or if the specified run level is not one of the allowed constants.

    • getRunlevel

      public SystemRunlevel getRunlevel()
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Gets the run level of the server. See the definition of the run level constants for details of how to interpret this value.
      Specified by:
      getRunlevel in interface ISystemTools
      Returns:
      An int containing the runlevel

    • verifyConfig

      public String verifyConfig(RequestedUpgrade requestedUpgrade, String appVerifiersConfigFP, String plVerifiersConfigFP, FilenameDigestPair[] filenameDigestPairs, VerifyConfigReportOptions reportOptions)
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Creates a report about a server config represented by array of pairs of file names and file digests. The report answers the question if rolling or bluen green upgrade is possible or full upgrade is required. Also it contains information about incompatibly changed files if there are any.
      Specified by:
      verifyConfig in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      requestedUpgrade - type of the upgrade requested
      appVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for the application
      plVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for platform
      filenameDigestPairs - An array of pairs of file names and file digests
      reportOptions - additional options to configure report generation
      Returns:
      prepared report

    • verifyConfigUsingRemoteExtCfg

      public String verifyConfigUsingRemoteExtCfg(RequestedUpgrade requestedUpgrade, String appVerifiersConfigFP, String plVerifiersConfigFP, FilenameDigestPair[] partiallyDigestedFiles, VerifyConfigReportOptions reportOptions)
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Creates a report about a server config represented by array of pairs of file names and file digests. The report answers the question if rolling or blue green upgrade is possible or full upgrade is required. Also it contains information about incompatibly changed files if there are any. In contrast to verifyConfig, this method uses server's external configuration file to perform the substitution in configuration files before making a comparison.
      Specified by:
      verifyConfigUsingRemoteExtCfg in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      requestedUpgrade - type of the upgrade requested
      appVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for the application
      plVerifiersConfigFP - FP64 of the verifiers config file for platform
      partiallyDigestedFiles - An array of pairs of file names and digests of the files. If files are supposed to use substitutor - this files are merely compressed and is a subject for substitution on server.
      reportOptions - additional options to configure report generation
      Returns:
      prepared report

      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Starts the FULL upgrade process. Please refer to the docs for more details.

    • nodeFailed

      public void nodeFailed(String serverId, boolean forceCleanup)
      Description copied from interface: ISystemTools
      Cleans and releases resources (batch processes, plugins, message destinations etc) holding by a specified node. This method might have a dangerous impact if the node is still running.
      Specified by:
      nodeFailed in interface ISystemTools
      Parameters:
      serverId - Server Id.
      forceCleanup - proceed with the cleanup even if the node with the specified server id is still in the cluster.

      }
